did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Triangle-area organization founded in 1990, now disbanded; provided support for gay youth and other young people with questions about their sexual orientation.

Office files which chiefly consist of minutes of meetings, correspondence, financial records, publicity, including clippings, flyers, and pamphlets, and literature on AIDS and sexuality. Includes reports on nationwide trends and issues. Addition (2009-0076) (200 items; 0.2 lin. ft.; 1994-1998) consists of a 1994 binder with by-laws, notes, correspondence, program planning, and administrative information. Also includes a letter from 1998.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], OutRight Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The OutRight Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1997-2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Triangle-area organization founded in 1990, now disbanded; provided support for gay youth and other young people with questions about their sexual orientation.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Office files which chiefly consist of minutes of meetings, correspondence, financial records, publicity, including clippings, flyers, and pamphlets, and literature on AIDS and sexuality. Includes reports on nationwide trends and issues.

Addition (2009-0076) (200 items; 0.2 lin. ft.; 1994-1998) consists of a 1994 binder with by-laws, notes, correspondence, program planning, and administrative information. Also includes a letter from 1998.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
